Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 42nd overall pick, by Troy in 1964...
Injured on 4/22/1968 with a Dislocated Finger, out for one week...
Had first career hit on 6/9/1969, off Brett Ramthun (PON)...
Injured on 9/15/1969 with a Pulled Hamstring Muscle, out for one week...
Traded from Troy to Boston (FBA) on 6/6/1970 (Going to SHP: RF E. Barham. Going to TRO: P P. Bleau, P B. Casey)...
Hit first career homerun on 8/1/1970, off Timothy Ponte (NE)...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/15/1971, hitting .484 with 2 HR, 8 RBI...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Rightfield in 1971...
Drove in 6 runs against Columbus on 6/5/1972...
Was selected to the 1972 Allstar game...
Was selected to the 1977 Allstar game...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1977...
Won World Championship with Boston (FBA) in 1980...
Signed as a free agent by New Jersey on 2/14/1981 to a 2-year deal worth $429,400 per year...
Released by New Jersey on 4/7/1982...
